com.ociweb.xml
Class DOMUtil

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ociweb.xml.DOMUtil
public class DOMUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Provides static methods that make using DOM easier.

Author:
R. Mark Volkmann, Object Computing, Inc.

addChildElement

public static org.w3c.dom.Element addChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Node parent,
                                                  java.lang.String childElementName)
Creates a child element with a given name and adds it to a given parent element. Note that the parent must already be directly or indirectly attached to a Document.
Parameters:
parent - the parent Node (should be an Element)
childElementName - the name of the child Element to be created
Returns:
the new child Element

childElementName - the name of the child Element to be created
value - the Date value of the child Element
Returns:
the new child Element

addNonNullChildElement

public static org.w3c.dom.Element addNonNullChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Node parent,
                                                         java.lang.String childElementName,
                                                         java.lang.String text)
Creates a child element with a given name and text content and adds it to a given parent element ONLY IF the text is not null. Note that the parent must already be directly or indirectly attached to a Document.
Parameters:
parent - the parent Node (should be an Element)
childElementName - the name of the child Element to be created
text - the text value of the child Element
Returns:
the new child Element

Parameters:

childElementName - the name of the child Element to be created
text - the text value of the child Element

the new child Element

Determines whether two documents are canonically equivalent.
Parameters:
doc1 - the first Document
doc2 - the second Document
Returns:
true if canonically equivalent; false otherwise

public static java.lang.String getCanonical(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                            boolean trimWhitespace)
Gets the canonical representation of a Document.
Parameters:
doc - the Document
trimWhitespace - true to trim text nodes containing only whitespace; false otherwise
Returns:
the canonical representation

getChildValue

public static java.lang.String getChildValue(org.w3c.dom.Node parent,
                                             java.lang.String childName)
Gets the text value of a specified child Element within a given parent Element.
Parameters:
parent - the parent Element
childName - the name of the child Element
Returns:
the text value of the child Element.

getTextValue

public static java.lang.String getTextValue(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
Gets the text value of a text-only Element. If the node passed in is not an Element or does not contain a single Text Node then null is returned.
Parameters:
node - the Element
Returns:
the text content.

public static java.lang.String getXMLString(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                            int indentAmount)
Gets a string representation of an XML Document.
Parameters:
doc - the Document
indentAmount - number of spaces to indent (can be zero)
Returns:
the String representation.

                                            java.lang.String dtdURI,
                                            int indentAmount)
Gets a string representation of an XML Document.
Parameters:
doc - the Document
dtdURI - the URI of the DTD or null
indentAmount - number of spaces to indent (can be zero)
Returns:
the String representation.

Creates a new, empty XML Document object.

an empty Document object.

                             java.lang.String dtdURI,
                             java.lang.String encoding,

result - the output Result

indentAmount - number of spaces to indent (can be zero)

trimWhitespace

public static void trimWhitespace(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
Recursively removes all text nodes containing only whitespace and trims whitespace from the beginning and end of all attribute and element values.

validate

public static boolean validate(java.lang.String fileURI)
                        throws org.w3c.dom.DOMException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               org.xml.sax.SAXException
Validates an XML document.
Parameters:
fileURI - the URI of the XML file to be validated
Returns:
true if valid; false otherwise.
